description: Gray Sedge (Carex grayi) is an amazing plant species that adds a unique touch to the landscape. It is a small grass-like plant with slender, arching stems and light green, wooly foliage. The tiny sharp-tipped flowers in spring are a delightful addition. It's low-maintenance, shade-tolerant, and evergreen, providing year-round interest in the garden, both for its soft, colorful foliage and its arching, graceful form. Ideal for planting in rock gardens and in the front of beds and borders. It's also an excellent choice for containers or mixed-container plantings. It's perfect for providing contrast and texture in drought-tolerant, cottage, and woodland gardens.
